snippet: Here’s some vintage seating that really puts the “fur” in “furniture.”
abstract: Here’s some vintage seating that really puts the “fur” in “furniture.”
lead_paragraph: The chairs at Design Miami have grown fur. A number of vintage pieces, which bring to mind Hans Wegner’s Halyard chair and the artist François-Xavier Lalanne’s sheep series, have had their hard edges softened by upholstery in shearling or Mongolian lamb. Juliet Burrows, of the Scandinavia-focused New York design gallery Hostler Burrows, says of the pieces: “They sell out as soon as we put them on the floor.”

headline.main: Three’s a Trend | Wild, Woolly Chairs at Design Miami
